user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of fast_simple_hash:
```c
static uint32_t
fast_simple_hash (const uint8_t *data,
                  size_t data_size)
{
  uint32_t hash;

  if (0 != data_size)
  {
    size_t i;
    hash = data[0];
    for (i = 1; i < data_size; i++)
      hash = _MHD_ROTL32 (hash, 7) ^ data[i];
  }
  else
    hash = 0;

  return hash;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (0 != data_size)
  {
    size_t i;
    hash = data[0];
    for (i = 1; i < data_size; i++)
      hash = _MHD_ROTL32 (hash, 7) ^ data[i];
  }
  else
    hash = 0;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: both the if and else branches are reachable depending on the runtime value of data_size (non‑zero vs zero). There is no code that can never be executed, so Rule 2.1 is not violated.
